pullRequest.title: FLINK-17142: Bump ORC dependency version to 1.5.6
pullRequest.bodyText:
What is the purpose of the change
Flink's ORC dependency is 1.4.3 which is little outdated so it makes sense to upgrade to a more latest stable version.
Brief change log

Update orc.version to 1.5.6
Fixed a failing test case.
Added org.apache.hadoop:hadoop-hdfs to the exclusions in flink-orc and flink-orc-nohive module since orc-core:1.5.6 has hadoop-hdfs as a compile time dependency

Verifying this change
This change is a trivial rework / code cleanup without any test coverage.
Does this pull request potentially affect one of the following parts:

Dependencies (does it add or upgrade a dependency): (yes)
The public API, i.e., is any changed class annotated with @Public(Evolving): (no)
The serializers: (no)
The runtime per-record code paths (performance sensitive): (no)
Anything that affects deployment or recovery: JobManager (and its components), Checkpointing, Kubernetes/Yarn/Mesos, ZooKeeper: (no)
The S3 file system connector: (no)

Documentation

Does this pull request introduce a new feature? (no)
If yes, how is the feature documented? (not applicable)

commit.message: FLINK-17142: Bump ORC dependency version to 1.5.6

nodes.bodyText: Yes, good job, it should same to AbstractOrcColumnVector

commit.message: FLINK-17142: Set hive-connector orc version as 1.4.3
